str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From phos; to shed rays, i.e. To shine or to brighten up.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
And, even, also, namely.
From aphthartos; incorruptibility; genitive, unending existence; genuineness.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
